column4: linux will not capture the sounds recorded by the microphone. It does send the recordings directly to the speakers. What could be wrong?
I went through that problem about 24 hrs ago.
what soundcard do u have? Any idea?
wait i'll check
you have an idea how to find that out (i have an ibm thinkpad t42)
do something for me. In a terminal type "lsmod |grep snd"
did that. it is an AC97, do you need the rest of the output as well?
do u see "emu" in there anywhere? like "snd-emu10k1" is what I'm hoping for.
no there is nothing with emu in it
damn. Ah well. How I solved it was to install a package called aumix-gtk. It's basically a good gui for your sound mixer. Try installing it, and boosting the "line-in" option on the panel.
oke i will try that
u didn't try aumix-gtk? (btw, I think that's weird too.)
yes just installed it, but how do i run it :)
$aumix-gtk
$aumix
aumix does not change the status of my problem (sorry to tell you)
did u try pumping up i-gain ?
hey wait... there we are... I am off and running eeuh recording
good. same problem. well, bad actually. There shouldn't be a problem in the first place.
hmm you use skype?
no. What is skype?
never mind :) thanks anyway
